alert.note: Alert for Eastern Greenbrier; Western Greenbrier (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 27 at 1:16AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...Persistent Heavy Rainfall Along Interstate 64 Corridor... An area of moderate to heavy rainshowers has persisted along and near the Interstate 64 corridor from Rainelle, to Lewisburg, to White Sulphur Springs, to Covington for the past couple of hours. Rainfall amounts are averaging 1/4 to 1/2 inch per hour along this corridor, resulting in around an inch or so in the past couple of hours. This rainfall is likely to continue for a while longer. Minor flooding and ponding of water on the Interstate and surrounding roads and highways can be expected for at least the next couple of hours. Visibility will be reduced in areas of heavy rainfall. Reduce speed to reduce the hazard of hydroplaning. Be alert for minor flooding and ponding of water on the roadway. Avoid flooded roads and do not drive into areas where water covers the road.
